chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shantel Elyse Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shantel Elyse Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shantel Elyse Anderson was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
No contact directly or indirectly with victim 1.
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
No criminal conduct.
Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent. AODA/anger management- follow thru.
Provide DNA sample and be responsible for the cost.

Court rcvd' 3rd bond modification request, Deft would like to be released from soberlink. State rcvd' information on 08/22 from victim, reads to the Court on the record, victim is opposed to modification of bond. Court is concerned about lifting soberlink. State does have objections to modification. Court feels soberlink should remain. Court denies motion but allows day reporting to reset frequency of Reporting.
